alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 04 at 12:43AM EST until March 04 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Bands of heavy snow expected. Additional accumulation up to 3 inches for storm total of 6 to 10 inches. Northerly wind gusts around 40 mph. * WHERE... St Clair county. * WHEN... now until 4 AM. * IMPACTS... Dangerous travel conditions tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... The winter storm is past peak intensity, however bands of heavy snow remain focused on the Thumb region down to Lapeer and Port Huron. Up to 3 inches of additional accumulation brings storm totals into the 6 to 10 inch range. Low visibility is enhanced by wind gusts near 40 mph. Expect both the snow and wind to diminish by 4 AM.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
